@AansPaa @PinheiroFilJoa @OScottson @IAPonomarenko Explosives-laden rail boxcar.

subs.text: @TwitterSupport A #FeatureRequest for your iOS app: allow pasting Twitter share URLs (e.g. copies from the web or a note document) into the #SearchBox inside the app. Current outcome: “No results found” Expected outcome: the linked Tweet is shown in the app Example link: [link]
subs.rawText:
@TwitterSupport 

A #FeatureRequest for your iOS app: allow pasting Twitter share URLs (e.g. copies from the web or a note document) into the #SearchBox inside the app.

Current outcome: “No results found”

Expected outcome: the linked Tweet is shown in the app

Example link: https://t.co/6WjLH0zRsf

subs.text: (The Twitter username and ‘tweet serial number/UID’(?) are right there in the URL, as seen below; no lookups or backend changes should be required to implement this, just a tiny bit of string #parsing within the app itself.) [link]
subs.rawText:
(The Twitter username and ‘tweet serial number/UID’(?) are right there in the URL, as seen below; 

no lookups or backend changes should be required to implement this, just a tiny bit of string #parsing within the app itself.) https://t.co/5Jg7thsRfx

subs.text:
@ReflectiveKen @AuthorConfusion @jonsteingard I thought the (fictional) description was more akin to a blender or a parallel-to-serial encoder;

i.e. the matter isn’t converted to energy, but rather sent in a very tight stream (as subatomic or perhaps quantum particles?) and then reassembled (much as a 3d printer does).
subs.rawText:
@ReflectiveKen @AuthorConfusion @jonsteingard I thought the (fictional) description was more akin to a blender or a parallel-to-serial encoder;

i.e. the matter isn’t converted to energy, but rather sent in a very tight stream (as subatomic or perhaps quantum particles?) and then reassembled (much as a 3d printer does).

subs.text:
@ReflectiveKen @AuthorConfusion @jonsteingard (tight enough to pass through the mostly empty space in otherwise ‘solid’ walls, etc.)

If it was purely an energy-based copy, you could always reassemble the new version (and verify accuracy) before destroying the old - killing nearly all plots involving transporter ‘accidents’!
subs.rawText:
@ReflectiveKen @AuthorConfusion @jonsteingard (tight enough to pass through the mostly empty space in otherwise ‘solid’ walls, etc.)

subs.text: July 5

@octavia324 @missykender @bluebirdpoopies @OneSquirreliest @KevOnStage The main Seattle branch uses the same cards as the other many neighborhood branches of the #SeattlePublicLibrary (@SPLBuzz).

[While Seattle has a separate system than the rest of King County (@KCLS), the two systems offer free reciprocity.]

subs.text: July 2

@Lift_Our_Voice @Freakonomics {it seems the graduate student and his honest-to-a-fault fiancée, after actually saying it out loud, realized what they were suggesting and _did not_ actually steal any wood}

But yes, sadly, those #TragedyOfTheCommons results are …common; see: #ClimateChange & #CampaignFinance.

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice Exactly.
  Make new friends.
    Ask if they are registered to vote; if not, offer to help them to find out how to register or request mail/#absentee ballots.

Offer to walk with them to the polls, or help to arrange rides for those who need it.

  Election day should be a party!
subs.rawText:
@Lift_Our_Voice Exactly.
  Make new friends.
    Ask if they are registered to vote; if not, offer to help them to find out how to register or request mail/#absentee ballots.

Offer to walk with them to the polls, or help to arrange rides for those who need it.

  Election day should be a party!

subs.text: @Lift_Our_Voice #SocialProof “Japan in the Covid-19 pandemic, where they looked at the willingness … to wear a mask, and they looked at a variety of possible reasons: … The only one that made any difference was the number of people they saw wearing masks.” [link]
subs.rawText:
@Lift_Our_Voice #SocialProof

“Japan in the Covid-19 pandemic, where they looked at the willingness … to wear a mask, and they looked at a variety of possible reasons: …  

The only one that made any difference was the number of people they saw wearing masks.”

https://t.co/HT4K6OBr04

And they were standing in front of a sign …”

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice @Freakonomics “…at the entrance that said, 

‘So many people are stealing petrified wood and crystals that the forest is endangered.’

Some kind of language like that. And my graduate student, while he was still reading the sign, felt this elbow in his ribs, and …”

3/4

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice @Freakonomics “…his invariably honest fiancée said, 

      ‘We better get ours, too.’

(Stephen) DUBNER: ‘Before it’s all gone.’”

~

(That episode also has great stories about the #CubanMissileCrisis, online product reviews, #PsychologicalReactance, and _many_ other topics.)

4/4

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice @Freakonomics A final quote from social psychologist @RobertCialdini:

“Thinking is hard work.

    Especially in an environment of such challenge and change and overload.

        So, it is simpler and easier to use our shortcuts.

            …”

1/2

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice @Freakonomics @RobertCialdini “…

    Most of the time, if they’re well-founded, they steer us correctly.

        But some percentage of the time, they steer us very poorly.”

2/2

subs.text:
@Lift_Our_Voice For _each_ citizen that moves to a new state/area: perhaps they can befriend and convince, on average, _at least_ one new non-voting neighbor to actually vote within the first few months.

(The DoD would call this a #ForceMultiplier tactic.)

subs.text: July 1

‘The missions into Russia are “not a big secret,” said Shaman. “Sometimes it happens on a helicopter. Sometimes we go in by foot. Most of the times we’re able to locate the good entry point to fly in or to walk on foot into Russia and then afterwards, what can I say?”’ [link]
subs.rawText:
‘The missions into Russia are “not a big secret,” said Shaman. 

“Sometimes it happens on a helicopter. Sometimes we go in by foot. Most of the times we’re able to locate the good entry point to fly in or to walk on foot into Russia and then afterwards, what can I say?”’ https://t.co/QdcJgq3LXx
